intro: Melampyrum sylvaticum subsp. carpaticum, commonly known as the Carpathian touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant native to the Carpathian region. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, which are typically borne on elongated pedicels. It is often found in moist, shaded woodlands and along stream banks. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations and its potential medicinal properties.
